sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
An ifStatement is:

  if trueFalseExpn then
    statementsAndDeclarations
  { elsif trueFalseExpn then
    statementsAndDeclarations }
  [ else
    statementsAndDeclarations ]
  end if
sections.text_content:
An ifStatement is:
 if trueFalseExpn then  statementsAndDeclarations { elsif trueFalseExpn then  statementsAndDeclarations } [ else  statementsAndDeclarations ] end if

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
An if statement is used to choose among a set of statements (and declarations). One set (at most) is chosen and executed and then execution continues just beyond end if.

The expressions (the trueFalseExpressions) following the keyword if and each elsif are checked one after the other until one of them is found to be true, in which case the statements (and declarations) following the corresponding then are executed. If none of these expressions evaluates to true, the statements following else are executed. If no else is present and none of the expressions are true, no statements are executed and execution continues following the end if.
sections.text_content:
An if statement is used to choose among a set of statements (and declarations). One set (at most) is chosen and executed and then execution continues just beyond end if.
The expressions (the trueFalseExpressions) following the keyword if and each elsif are checked one after the other until one of them is found to be true, in which case the statements (and declarations) following the corresponding then are executed. If none of these expressions evaluates to true, the statements following else are executed. If no else is present and none of the expressions are true, no statements are executed and execution continues following the end if.
sections.mdown_content:
An **if** statement is used to choose among a set of statements (and declarations). One set (at most) is chosen and executed and then execution continues just beyond **end** **if**.
The expressions (the *trueFalseExpressions*) following the keyword **if** and each **elsif** are checked one after the other until one of them is found to be true, in which case the statements (and declarations) following the corresponding **then** are executed. If none of these expressions evaluates to true, the statements following **else** are executed. If no **else** is present and none of the expressions are true, no statements are executed and execution continues following the **end** **if**.

sections.title: Example
code:
if mark >= 50 then
            put "You pass"
        else
            put "You fail"
        end if
sections.raw_content: Output a message based on value of mark.
sections.text_content: Output a message based on value of mark.
sections.mdown_content: Output a message based on value of mark.

sections.title: Example
code:
if mark >= 80 then
            put "A"
        elsif mark >= 70 then
            put "B"
        elsif mark >= 60 then
            put "C"
        elsif mark >= 50 then
            put "D"
        else
            put "F"
        end if
sections.raw_content: Output A, B, C, D or F depending on mark.
sections.text_content: Output A, B, C, D or F depending on mark.
sections.mdown_content: Output A, B, C, D or F depending on mark.

sections.title: Example
code:
if x < 0 then
            x := - x
        end if
sections.text_content: If x is negative, change its sign.

sections.title: Example
code:
if x < 0  or x > maxx then
            put "Out of bounds!"
        end if
sections.raw_content: If x is less than zero or greater than maxx, put a message.
sections.text_content: If x is less than zero or greater than maxx, put a message.
sections.mdown_content: If *x *is less than zero or greater than maxx, put a message.

sections.title: Example
code:
if flag  and name = "stop" then
            put "Exiting routine"
            return
        end if
sections.raw_content: If the boolean flag is true and name is “stop”, put a message and return.
sections.text_content: If the boolean flag is true and name is stop, put a message and return.
sections.mdown_content: If the boolean *flag* is true and *name* is stop, put a message and return.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Several statements and declarations can appear after a particular then.
sections.text_content: Several statements and declarations can appear after a particular then.
sections.mdown_content: Several statements and declarations can appear after a particular **then**.
